message_1:
A company has to complete four tasks, each task requires a different amount of time to complete:
- Task 1 takes 5 hours to complete
- Task 2 takes 8 hours to complete
- Task 3 takes 6 hours to complete
- Task 4 takes 4 hours to complete

The company's goal is to complete all tasks in the shortest amount of time possible. However, they have a limited number of workers that can work on the tasks at the same time. Two workers can work together on one task and can complete it in half the time it would take for one worker to complete the task alone. 

If the company has two workers available, what is the optimal scheduling plan that will allow them to complete all tasks in the shortest amount of time possible?
message_2:
To minimize the total time taken to complete all tasks, the company should pair the tasks with the largest difference in completion times. This way, the workers can complete the tasks more efficiently.

First, let's pair Task 2 (8 hours) with Task 4 (4 hours). When two workers work together, they can complete Task 2 in 4 hours and Task 4 in 2 hours. So, they will complete both tasks in 4 hours.

Next, pair Task 1 (5 hours) with Task 3 (6 hours). When two workers work together, they can complete Task 1 in 2.5 hours and Task 3 in 3 hours. So, they will complete both tasks in 3 hours.

The optimal scheduling plan is:
1. Worker 1 and Worker 2 work together on Task 2 and Task 4 for 4 hours.
2. Worker 1 and Worker 2 work together on Task 1 and Task 3 for 3 hours.

The total time taken to complete all tasks is 4 hours + 3 hours = 7 hours.
